results:
Based on the search results, I found valuable information about the first Polish edition of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World" ("Nowy wspaniały świat"):

The first Polish edition was published by Wydawnictwo Rój in 1933, not 1935 as mentioned in your query. There was also a second edition published later.

The search results show that "Nowy wspaniały świat" was published by Wydawnictwo Rój in 1933 as the first edition. However, the search results don't provide specific information about the translator "Roj" that you mentioned - it appears "Roj" refers to the publishing house (Wydawnictwo Rój) rather than the translator's name.

The original English edition was written by Aldous Huxley in 1931 and published in 1932, making the Polish translation quite prompt, appearing just one year after the original publication.

Unfortunately, the search results don't contain specific information about the actual translator of the first Polish edition, so I cannot confirm who translated this seminal dystopian novel into Polish for the 1933 Roj edition.
